alert.note: Alert for Lee; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 10:30AM CDT until August 14 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following areas, northern De Kalb, far northern Lee, and southern Ogle. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It may take several hours for water from earlier storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 AM CDT, street flooding continues in the warned area due to earlier thunderstorms. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... DeKalb, Sycamore, Rochelle, Oregon, Polo, Cortland, Hinckley, Hillcrest, Maple Park, Malta, Ashton, Lost Nation, Creston, Grand Detour, Lee, Steward, Kings, Chana and Woosung. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
